N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2172.2 - Report requirements

State Regulations

The report shall include: (a) the amount of each payment, loan or grant
and the identity of recipients thereof; (b) a narrative description of the specific
activities performed by the grantee and the results thereof expressed in number
of housing units; (c) locations of
homes; (d) number of units in each
category of homes completed during the year or in process and a cumulative
statement of such information from the commencement of the project(s) or
program to the reporting date; (e) a
report of the grantee's continued monitoring of construction progress and
conditions for recapture of funds and, if applicable to the grantee's
project(s) or program, for the limitation of the resale price of
homes; (f) a description of any
problems encountered in advancing the project(s) or program, solutions
developed to meet such problems, and whether any problems are currently
outstanding; (g) in the case of all
grantees other than municipalities, an audited financial statement, prepared by
an independent, certified public accountant, relating to the grantee's most
recent fiscal year; if the grantee's fiscal year coincides with the calendar
year, notwithstanding the provisions of section
2172.1
of this Part requiring the
submission by December 15th, such statement must be submitted within 90 days
after the close of the grantee's fiscal year; and
(h) a statement of costs (including expended
and/or incurred costs) concerning the project(s) or program certified by the
grantee and relating to the period covered by the report. Notes
